note.p: Death Place: 'Maritima', his house at Brighton Beach, near Melbourne, Australia (13 or 15 or 16 May 1899)

Career: Gave up medicine in favour of natural science; worked on Geological Survey of Ireland; Professor of Geology and Mineralogy, Queen's College, Belfast; Professor of Natural Sciences, University of Melbourne; Government Palaeontologist; established the National museum of Natural History, Melbourne, and was its Director
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 43-45 signed by H W
Notes: WWW gives death date as 15 May 1899, TR/BR give 16 May 1899.
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
